1.5 Continuity

Ex1.

Determine whether the function \( f(x) = \frac{x^2 - 4}{x - 2} \) is continuous at \( x = 2 \).

Solution

  1. Check if \( f(2) \) is defined:

    • Substituting \( x = 2 \): \[ f(2) = \frac{2^2 - 4}{2 - 2} = \frac{0}{0}, \] which is undefined. Thus, \( f(x) \) is not defined at \( x = 2 \).

  2. Simplify the function:

    • Factor the numerator: \[ f(x) = \frac{x^2 - 4}{x - 2} = \frac{(x - 2)(x + 2)}{x - 2}. \]
    • Cancel \( x - 2 \): \[ f(x) = x + 2, \quad \text{for } x \neq 2. \]
